page.title: 19Leaden Roding Police 2
page.content: The local Policeman works an 8 hour day for 7 days then he has 2 or 3 days off. He does have to carry his identification around with him at all times. He has been trained in First Aid and Riot Control and he has to go on courses every 2 to 3 years. Three Policemen are on duty at any one time in the area, plus the Traffic Department. There is no cell in Leaden Roding for prisoners, they now have to be sent to Harlow or Saffron Walden. If help is needed then a call is sent to Dunmow. In an emergency the nearest cars would assist. As well as his normal duties ,the local Policeman spends time in school, teaching the "Green Cross Code", telling the children something of the History of the Police, telling the children not to go with strangers and taking the children for Cycling Proficiency.
